item.title: Widget Positions
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: We use this page to let you know our available widget positions which you may use. Its important to know that widget positions are collapsible, which means that they will take the place of each other. In other words, if you display 2 widgets on the "promo widget area" they will each take 50% of the space, if you display 3 widgets, they will be devided into 33% each and so on. However we dont reccomend that you display more than 4 widgets in a row. If you put the class "widget_styled" on the widget settings "CSS class" you will get a different styled widget based on the primary color, as you are seeing on this page, some widgets are styled differently with a background color. Also, note that the "CSS class" setting is done through the help of a plugin called "Widget CSS Classes"

item.title: Customize Options
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Below there are the options that you will find under the "Appearance - Customise" in your Wordpress admin panel that we have made for this Free Wordpress Theme. We haven't included the default Wordpress options like "Site Identity". Also, as you may already know we don't provide lots of options and settings for our Wordpress Themes. Our aim is to provide only the necessary elements for you to easily finish your next Wordpress project.

Template Main Color

You may change the template main colour easily to your preferred colour style.

Logo

Beside that you may use the default "Site Identity" option to display the logo as text you may simply use a logo image for your website.

Fixed Header

An option to enable or not the fixed header when the site scrolls down the navigation on top stays fixed.

Social Media Links

Choose the social icons that you like to display on the right part of the website.

item.title: Offline page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: The offline page can be configured over at plugins -> WP Maintenance Mode -> settings. Enable or disable it via Status. You can set the access level of users that are able to access your website's backend or frontend via the "backend" and "frontend" roles, respectively. On the Design tab you can set the Title, heading and the text, as well as choose the background. On the Modules tab you can set a countdown if desired, and enable it to be visible, you can also show social network icons like facebook, twitter, google+ and so on. The contact form can be enabled there a well, with its defined email address. Checkout a screenshot on how can your offline page can look...

item.title: Typography
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Headings

h1. Bootstrap heading

h2. Bootstrap heading

h3. Bootstrap heading

h4. Bootstrap heading

h5. Bootstrap heading
h6. Bootstrap heading
  The following codes can help you create headings: 

<h1>h1. Bootstrap heading</h1>
<h2>h2. Bootstrap heading</h2>
<h3>h3. Bootstrap heading</h3>
<h4>h4. Bootstrap heading</h4>
<h5>h5. Bootstrap heading</h5>
<h6>h6. Bootstrap heading</h6>
 

Blockquotes

Blockquotes can be used to create blocks, when you want to quote someone or something. Add a
for identifying the source. Wrap the name of the source work in.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer posuere erat a ante.
Someone famous in Source Title
You can use the following code or the button from your HTML editor. 

<blockquote>
<p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer posuere erat a ante.</p>
<footer>Someone famous in <cite title="Source Title">Source Title</cite></footer>
</blockquote>
 

Tables

Below is a table, with 4 styles: Table - a normal table Table-striped - a table with stripes, zebra-like Table-bordered - a table with borders Table-hover - on hover on any rows, the row will have an effect
Row First Name Last Name Email
1 John Doe johndoe@mail.com
2 Peter Parker peterparker@mail.com
3 John Rambo johnrambo@mail.com
Notice how the table above is responsive? As you can see below, the table is wrapped in the class "table-responsive", on the first <div>. 

<div class="table-responsive">
<table class="table table-striped table-bordered table-hover">
<thead>
<tr>
<th>Row</th>
<th>First Name</th>
<th>Last Name</th>
<th>Email</th>
</tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
<tr>
<td>1</td>
<td>John</td>
<td>Doe</td>
<td>johndoe@mail.com</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>2</td>
<td>Peter</td>
<td>Parker</td>
<td>peterparker@mail.com</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>3</td>
<td>John</td>
<td>Rambo</td>
<td>johnrambo@mail.com</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
</div>
 

Buttons

Here are some examples to easily create some flashy ones These are the codes to achieve the above results, respectively 

<!-- Our Own Button -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-en">Envision</button>

<!-- Standard button -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-default">Default</button>

<!-- Provides extra visual weight and identifies the primary action in a set of buttons -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-primary">Primary</button>

<!-- Indicates a successful or positive action -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-success">Success</button>

<!-- Contextual button for informational alert messages -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-info">Info</button>

<!-- Indicates caution should be taken with this action -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-warning">Warning</button>

<!-- Indicates a dangerous or potentially negative action -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-danger">Danger</button>

<!-- Deemphasize a button by making it look like a link while maintaining button behavior -->
<button type="button" class="btn btn-link">Link</button>
 

Images

The following images are actually 1 image, which has been modified by CSS to give 3 different results. The following images were modified with CSS using this code: 

<img src="..." alt="..." class="img-rounded">
<img src="..." alt="..." class="img-circle">
<img src="..." alt="..." class="img-thumbnail">

Contextual backgrounds

[su_accordion] [su_spoiler title="What is OfficialTheme and what it does?"]We are a Web Design company, proudly working from Tirana, Albania. Our goal is to provide simple yet beautiful themes for you to easily finish your next project![/su_spoiler]
[su_spoiler title="How do i get theme support?"]You may use our Support Forums to get help for our Free Wordpress Themes or any other related support questions.[/su_spoiler]
[su_spoiler title="Why you are releasing your Wordpress Themes for free?"]In fact we will provide Premium-like quality themes for Free. We want to attract a large-base of users, and additionally earn from advertising. We choose this strategy as we think as it will benefit more our users (will get themes for free), and our financial goals as well. [/su_spoiler]
[su_spoiler title="How can i contact you? (not support)"]You are welcome to write an email at our Email address found on our contact us page, or additionally you may call us at +355 4 2266999 (we recommend that you email us first). Also, note that we are located in central Europe (check timezones)[/su_spoiler] [/su_accordion]

item.title: About us
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
About our awesome company

Our goal is to deliver simple yet beautiful Free WordPress Themes so that you can finish with ease your next website project.

We like minimal design, not that it’s easy for us to achieve (well in fact it is), but our primary focus is your end-user, which will ultimately be the one who will interact with your website. We always keep it simple.

OfficialTheme, which is part of the Envision Group, was created solely to provide simple yet beautiful themes for the WordPress community. Our aim is that you may easily finish your website projects and to have additional time for yourself and for you family. Our designs are minimalist, focused only on the necessary elements.

Beside you, we think for your end-users as well, which will ultimately be the one that will interact with your website. Our aim for them is a simple and pleaant browsing experience.

Our Team

Out team is made by talented individuals who share the love for Wordpres!

John Doe
CEO and Founder
Jessie Boone
Marketing
Charles Myers
Design
Archibald
Moral Support

Our Location

We want to collaborate face to face with each other that's why all our team is based on the same city

[su_gmap width="600" height="300" responsive="yes" address="Tirana" class=""]
OfficialTheme Free WordPress Themes. 1355 Market Street, Suite 900 San Francisco, CA 94103 P: (123) 456-7890

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Deluxe Easter
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Pellentesque habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus et malesuada fames ac turpis egestas. Vestibulum tortor quam, feugiat vitae, ultricies eget, tempor sit amet, ante. Donec eu libero sit amet quam egestas semper. Aenean ultricies mi vitae est. Mauris placerat eleifend leo.

item.content:encoded: Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in Bookmar right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean. A small river ... Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth. Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar. The Big Oxmox advised her not to do so, because there were thousands of bad Commas, wild Question Marks and devious Semikoli, but the Little Blind Text didn’t listen. She packed her seven versalia, put her initial into the belt and made herself on the way. When she reached the first hills of the Italic Mountains, she had a last view back on the skyline of her hometown Bookmarksgrove, the headline of Alphabet Village and the subline of her own road, the Line Lane. Pityful a rethoric question ran over her cheek, then she continued her way. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth. Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar. The Big Oxmox advised her not to do so, because there were thousands of bad Commas, wild Question Marks and devious Semikoli, but the Little Blind Text didn’t listen. Separated they live in Bookmar right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean. A small river ... Far far away, behind the word mountains, far from the countries Vokalia and Consonantia, there live the blind texts. Separated they live in Bookmarksgrove right at the coast of the Semantics, a large language ocean. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth. Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar. The Big Oxmox advised her not to do so, because there were thousands of bad Commas, wild Question Marks and devious Semikoli, but the Little Blind Text didn’t listen. She packed her seven versalia, put her initial into the belt and made herself on the way. When she reached the first hills of the Italic Mountains, she had a last view back on the skyline of her hometown Bookmarksgrove, the headline of Alphabet Village and the subline of her own road, the Line Lane. Pityful a rethoric question ran over her cheek, then she continued her way. A small river named Duden flows by their place and supplies it with the necessary regelialia. It is a paradisematic country, in which roasted parts of sentences fly into your mouth. Even the all-powerful Pointing has no control about the blind texts it is an almost unorthographic life One day however a small line of blind text by the name of Lorem Ipsum decided to leave for the far World of Grammar. The Big Oxmox advised her not to do so, because there were thousands of bad Commas, wild Question Marks and devious Semikoli, but the Little Blind Text didn’t listen. She packed her seven versalia, put her initial into the belt and made herself on the way. When she reached the first hills of the Italic Mountains, she had a last view back on the skyline of her hometown Bookmarksgrove, the

item.content:encoded: Pellentesque habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus et malesuada fames ac turpis egestas. Vestibulum tortor quam, feugiat vitae, ultricies eget, tempor sit amet, ante. Donec eu libero sit amet quam egestas semper. Aenean ultricies mi vitae est. Mauris placerat eleifend leo.

Donec eu libero sit amet quam egestas semper. Aenean ultricies mi vitae est. Mauris placerat eleifend leo.

item.title: Meet me in provence
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded: Pellentesque habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus et malesuada fames ac turpis egestas. Vestibulum tortor quam, feugiat vitae, ultricies eget, tempor sit amet, ante. Donec eu libero sit amet quam egestas semper. Aenean ultricies mi vitae est. Mauris placerat eleifend leo.
